lines.text: The blues ain't nothin' but a good man feelin' bad, thinkin' 'bout the woman he once was with.
Meet Blind Dog Fulton. The one and only Willie Brown. You have found your man.
Aw, this GREAT, this is great! Listen, I know I'm not Robert Johnson, I...

[interrupting]
No, you AIN'T. You ain't even the beginning of a pimple on the "Late Great" Robert Johnson's ass! You might have a little bit of lightning in you, but you're missing everything else.
Where I come from, you don't blow no harp, you don't get no pussy.
You know Willie, I came down here to learn a lost song, not to get slapped in the face by an 80-year-old man! I find out I gotta become "King of the Hobos" I can go broke...

[interrupting him angrily]
I'm sorry your life turned out so 'HARD', Eugene! But I got my own business to tend to down here, and I don't mean for you to slow me down.
Business? What business?
Personal business. And given your attitude, you got no reason to know what.
My attitude? What the hell's the matter with MY attitude, I have a great attitude!
You got your mind made up about how everything works. How you gonna learn anything new when you KNOW everything already?
[picks up Eugene's old, scratched acoustic guitar]

Look at this old guitar here you been squeakin' on. I bet you saw this thing in a music store and bought it just because you thought it was beat up! Well you got it all wrong. Muddy Waters invented electricity.
Why do you want to know about all that stuff?
I'm a blues man.
A blues man?
[starts laughing]
Where you from, boy?
Well, I was born in Long Island.
the famous 'breeding ground' for blues men!
[laughing almost hysterically]
You can't get enough mileage living at home with your Momma' wiping your butt.
Where do you live?
It's a school dormitory.

[sarcastically]
Ooh, school dormitory. Oh, times is hard. Times is hard!
OK, Mr. Janitor Man. What you want? I ain't made no mess.
Willie Brown?
That's my name.
Hey Willie, look at this hat. All I need is a Mississippi string tie and I'm ready to roll!
Yeah, you need a lot more than THAT.
They find out I can walk, they take away my Pontiac!
Blind Dog and Lightning Boy? Who the hell are you guys supposed to be?
We're bluesmen...
*I'm* the bluesman, he's from Long Island!
What are you doing?
I'm changin' my tie, and I could use some help.

[hastily changing Willie's tie]
I oughtta choke ya.

[brandishing his fist]
You do and you get knocked on your ass.
I'm a blues man!
Blues man shit.
Lots of towns... Lots of songs... Lots of women... Good times... Bad times... Only thing I wanted anyone to say is... 'He could really play... He was good'.
Where and when for this thing?
Ohh, I can get us there real quick... Jack Butler's gonna like you.
Oh, so the famous long island blues man come back for another visit, huh?
I have something that I think you'll be interested in.
Is somebody saying he ain't been believing when I've been speaking?

That's right, Willie, I'm saying you're full of shit! You know something, everytime you mention Fulton's Point, nobody's ever even heard of the godamned place! And I'm starting to think you're just a con-man who used me just to get your ass out of a nursing home!
[Willie and Eugene start to walk away from each other on opposite sides of the road]
Where are you going?
Look, you smart-assed kids, you don't need me! I do my business on this side of the road, and you white folks do your business on that side; that's the way they get things done in Mississippi!
Oh, shit. Here we go, a little soul from the golden ghetto.
Look Willie, cut the shit, all right? Now, I'm serious about this song!
The only shit to cut around here is you. Now I had it in me that you was another 'Lightning Boy', but you just a chicken-ass.
[stands up]
Chicken-ass, chicken shit!
Ain't got no chance Blind Dog. You SOLD your soul. You goin' down, all the way down. Hell hounds on your trail, boy, hell hounds on your trail.
Willie, here's something from the Delta, tell me this isn't Son House.
[plays a flawless blues riff in key of E]
Sounds like bird shit.

[Trying to intimidate Eugene]
Well well well... who sent you here? Can't talk little man?
[laughs]
Bet ya can't play none, either!

[Eugene plugs in his guitar and stares back at him, saying nothing]
Uh huh!
I'll see you in hell, Willie Brown.
